bill_title: require highly qualified teachers and to limit the use of unqualified substitute teachers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require highly qualified teachers and to limit the use of unqualified substitute teachers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-43 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person employed to teach in a public school in this state or draw wages as a teacher shall be highly qualified. For purposes of this Act, a teacher is highly qualified if: (1) The teacher is fully licensed or certified by the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs for the subject being taught and demonstrates competency; and (2) The teacher fulfilled all of the licensure and certification requirements and no requirements were waived on an emergency, temporary, or provisional basis. Section 2. However, a school district may employ short-term substitute teachers who are not highly qualified. A short-term substitute teacher is a person hired by the school district to substitute on an intermittent basis for various highly qualified teachers. A short-term substitute teacher is not responsible for preparing lesson plans, developing curriculum, or assigning grades. No short-term substitute may provide instruction in place of the same teacher for more than twenty consecutive days.
